com.basho.riak.client.core.query.search

Class YokozunaIndex

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.basho.riak.client.core.query.search.YokozunaIndex

  • public class YokozunaIndex
extends Object
    Represents a Yokozuna Index.
    Author:
    Brian Roach

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      YokozunaIndex(String name)
      Constructs a Yokozuna index without naming the schema.

      Constructs a Yokozuna index.

    • Constructor Detail

      • YokozunaIndex

        public YokozunaIndex(String name)
        Constructs a Yokozuna index without naming the schema. Due to an implementation detail on the Riak side, the index name is restricted to US-ASCII characters. The supplied String is converted to bytes using the UTF-8 Charset.
        Parameters:
        name - The name for this index.

      • YokozunaIndex

        public YokozunaIndex(String name,
                     String schema)
        Constructs a Yokozuna index. Due to an implementation detail on the Riak side, the index name is restricted to US-ASCII characters. The supplied String is converted to bytes using the UTF-8 Charset.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the index.
        schema - The name of a schema

    • Method Detail

      • withNVal

        public YokozunaIndex withNVal(int nVal)
        Set the nVal.
        Parameters:
        nVal - the number of replicas.
        Returns:
        a reference to this object.

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Returns the name of this index as a UTF-8.
        Returns:
        The name of the index as UTF-8 encoded String.

      • getSchema

        public String getSchema()
        Returns the schema name for this index.
        Returns:
        The schema name.

      • hasNVal

        public boolean hasNVal()
        Determine if an nVal value has been set.
        Returns:
        true if set, false otherwise.

      • getNVal

        public Integer getNVal()
        Get the nVal.
        Returns:
        the nVal value or null if not set.
